metadata.title: CVE-2024-27413 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:efi/capsule-loader: fix incorrect allocation size gcc-14 notices that theallocation with sizeof(void) on 32-bit architectures is not enough for a64-bit phys_addr_t: drivers/firmware/efi/capsule-loader.c: In function'efi_capsule_open': drivers/firmware/efi/capsule-loader.c:295:24: error:allocation of insufficient size '4' for type 'phys_addr_t' {aka 'long longunsigned int'} with size '8' [-Werror=alloc-size] 295 | cap_info->phys =kzalloc(sizeof(void *), GFP_KERNEL); | ^ Use the correct type instead here.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27413` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
